definitions.definition: The act of assigning; the allocation of a job or a set of tasks.
definitions.example: This flow chart represents the assignment of tasks in our committee.

definitions.definition: The categorization of something as belonging to a specific category.
definitions.example: We should not condone the assignment of asylum seekers to that of people smugglers.
The assignment the department gave him proved to be quite challenging.

definitions.definition: A position to which someone is assigned.
definitions.example: Unbeknownst to Mr Smith, his new assignment was in fact a demotion.

definitions.definition: A task given to students, such as homework or coursework.
definitions.example: Mrs Smith gave out our assignments, and said we had to finish them by Monday.

definitions.definition: A transfer of a right or benefit from one person to another.
definitions.example: The assignment of the lease has not been finalised yet.

definitions.definition: A document that effects this transfer.
definitions.example: Once you receive the assignment in the post, be sure to sign it and send it back as soon as possible.

definitions.definition: An operation that assigns a value to a variable.
